title: Derivative of inverse trigonometric functions:csc(x)
text: The formula for the derivative of inverse csc(x) is $$\frac{d}{dx} {csc}^{-1} x=\frac{-1}{|x| \sqrt{x^2-1}}$$.

title: Applying the chain rule
text: Because the function $$\sqrt{x}$$ or $$x^{\frac{1}{2}}$$ has a function inside its parentheses,cos**(-1)(x) in this case, we need to apply the chain rule before using the formula from the previous hint. For reference, the chain rule is $$(f(g(x)))'=\operatorname{f'}\left(g{\left(x\right)}\right) \operatorname{g'}\left(x\right)$$.
